content: Which British author wrote the dystopian novel "1984" about a totalitarian society ruled by Big Brother?

The British author who wrote the dystopian novel "1984" about a totalitarian society ruled by Big Brother is George Orwell. The book was first published in 1949 and it depicts a future society that is controlled by a powerful government, which monitors and suppresses all aspects of people's lives. The novel is considered a classic of English literature and is widely regarded as one of the greatest works of dystopian fiction ever written.
